description:
Recruitment Direct UK is looking for an experienced Highway Engineer for the Local Authority Client in Hampshire.
 
Job Title: Highway Engineer (Asset management)
Location: Hybrid - Depot & Home. Depot location is likely to be Hook (TBC) Working from
home days to be discussed at interview stage.
£28.86 per hour


Any additional requirements:
DBS required: No
Driving Licence required: Yes - Car use
Planned Start Date: 01-04-2025
Role duration and typical hours: 3-6 months and then review - 37 hours max a week

Role Summary
As part of this role, the candidate should expect to carry out work within the following areas:
• Implement solutions, agree modifications and oversee the preparation of highway maintenance
and minor improvement schemes from identification of need, through detailed design and
implementation.
• Provide technical input throughout the construction period.
• Plan and programme resources for the design and implementation of annual programmes of
highway maintenance and minor improvement schemes.
• Establish agreed solutions with interested parties, which meet engineering, budgetary and
environmental requirements.
• Prepare estimates and raise works orders for highway maintenance and minor improvement
schemes.
• Monitor and review individual scheme budgets and agree final accounts for authorisation.
• Liaise with internal designers, local highway engineers, statutory undertakers, external
consultants, the term service Contractor and the general public.
• Represent the County Council at public meetings, to carry out consultations on programme
proposals and to advise County Councillors as necessary.
• Support and develop technical staff through effective supervision and allocation of work.
• Assist with the management of the Management Branch to achieve business plan objectives,
including continuous improvement


Required Qualifications and Experience
• RQF Level 4 or Degree level qualification in a relevant field
• Incorporated Engineer with a relevant body or equivalent experience
• Knowledge of relevant highway design standards and procedures
• Experience in the design, management and supervision of highways maintenance works
• Appreciation of contract procedures, preferably with the NEC Term Service Contract

Decision Making Areas
• Assessing feasibility and detailed designs produced by junior staff
• Discussing and negotiating works with stakeholders, the public and elected members
• Solution of design and site-based issues
• Ensuring works are designed and constructed in line with relevant health and safety guidance
and legislation.

Working Conditions
• Working environment to be an equal split between hybrid (home and office) and site.
• Communicating with colleagues and contractors in a challenging environment.
• Ability to fulfil the travel requirements of the role.
• Some out of hours working, in the case of emergencies, flooding and extreme weather.
